meanings.sent1: The wolves were outhowling in the forest at night.
meanings.sent2: The neighbor's dog was outhowling in response to the sirens.
meanings.sent3: The outhowling of the wind made it hard to sleep.
meanings.sent4: His outhowling laughter echoed through the empty streets.
meanings.sent5: The outhowling of the storm was both eerie and beautiful.

meanings.definition: The act of howling loudly outside.
meanings.sent1: We could hear the distant outhowling of a pack of coyotes.
meanings.sent2: The outhowling of the wind kept us awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The outhowling of the children playing outside was music to her ears.
meanings.sent4: The outhowling of the crowd at the concert was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The outhowling of the storm drowned out all other sounds.
